item.title: WHEEL BRAKES – DEACTIVATED BY CAPPING BRAKE LINE (ALTERNATE METHOD)

remarks.para: One brake may be deactivated by capping off the brake line provided:

numlitem.para: Takeoff performance is based on Landing Gear Extended,
Takeoff and landing performance complies with AOM for one brake inoperative,
After takeoff, gear remains extended for two minutes prior to retraction, and
Anti-skid is operative on remaining wheels.

note.para: Dispatch is not allowed with a brake deactivated and the anti-skid system inoperative.

operation.para: (Use appropriate One Brake Deactivated worksheet respective to engine type, in Chapter 5.1 of the AOM.)

numlitem.para: After takeoff, the landing gear must remain extended for a minimum of two minutes to allow the wheel to spin down prior to gear retraction.
An additional 500 lbs of fuel must be added to account for additional drag of leaving landing gear extended.
See the destination airport landing chart for the runway limit weight for landing with one wheel brake deactivated.
Consult the Quick Turn-around Limit chart with one wheel brake deactivated, if necessary.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

note.para: Must be operative for dispatch into LPB, UIO, BOG, GUA, TGU.

numlitem.para: Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 3a.
Takeoff Performance limit weight (lower of runway/climb limit weight) reduced by:
Flaps 5 = 37,800 lbs
Flaps 15 = 31,400 lbs
Landing Weight Reduction – see destination airport landing chart for Max Landing Weight With One Brake Deactivated.
Additional 500 lbs of fuel required for planning purposes.
Flaps 1 or 20 takeoff operation is not allowed.
No operation with Improved Climb Performance is allowed.
If "OCA" is present on the airport analysis page and is greater than the level off height, contact Flight Control for alternate airport analysis data.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

placard.para: Placard Auto Brakes Control Panel "ONE BRAKE DEACTIVATED" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: Check that wheels are adequately chocked.
Ensure landing gear doors are closed.

warning.para: RAPID ACTION OF DOORS MAY INJURE PERSONNEL OR DAMAGE EQUIPMENT.

numlitem.para: Depressurize right and left hydraulic systems.
Release parking brakes.
Disconnect hydraulic brake line from brake to be deactivated. Cap line and plug fitting with #6 MS cap/plug (steel or CRES material only).
Secure loose brake hose to ensure no interference with wheel rotation and gear retraction.
Remove brake bleed fitting to prevent brake drag due to thermal effect.
Gain access to the anti-skid/autobrake control unit on the E5 rack.
Position Brake Test/Disable selector to the brake which was deactivated.
Pressurize right hydraulic system.
Apply brake pressure by depressing brake pedals and check for leaks.
